#clean data
```{r}
library(tidyverse)

baltimore_bridges <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2018-11-27/baltimore_bridges.csv") %>%
  select(-vehicles) %>%
  filter(yr_built >= 1880) %>%
  mutate(county = replace(county, county == "Baltimore city", "Baltimore City"))
```

#Just messing around to learn more about the data. Sandbox stuff
```{r}
baltimore_bridges %>%
  count(bridge_condition)
```

#count by decade
##%/% is integer division which just divides by the number after the operator and leaves no remainder
##e.g. 22 %/% 10 = 2 & 132 %/% 10 = 13
```{r}
baltimore_bridges %>%
  count(decadeBuilt = 10 * (yr_built %/% 10))
```
